text: looks awesome! I agree from an editing / ux perspective hubdb is lacking compared to a blog or a custom module.
explain how you are getting around the 200 limit?
oh
all post url
json feed, gotcha

Just hoping HS devs don't see that sort of thing and choose to prevent that from being possible. It would break a few of our biggest sites - without really a way of fixing without storing all the data off of HubSpot.

HubDB was built to solve a number of issues, including repurposing blogs as as database, something it was never intended for. HubDB should be faster and easier to work with. There’s also no 200-item limit. You should be able to do the same updating using your own UI and then sending it over with the HubDB API.
From a UX standpoint (out of the box )it is much easier for a client to update a custom module OR a blog that is templated out than it is to update hubdb
If I could have clients pay us to make a UI for them, that would be great
But I’m not in charge
So maybe what you’re looking for is custom edit forms for HubDB rows?
but on the other hand … a lot of people are comfortable with Excel … in that case hubdb can be better then the repurposed blog
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F8CMWR538/pasted_image_at_2017_12_08_10_25_am.png|team module in custom module>
i had situations when giving the option they went for hubdb
yeah, HubDB is designed to be a lot more like Excel than filling out a form
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F8BAL1YQ1/pasted_image_at_2017_12_08_10_26_am.png|using hubdb>
so maybe hubdb with an “edit row” that looks like a custom module
So, hubdb works great with text, uploading via spreadsheet and large data sets
but from a standpoint of being able to comprehend what you are editing, I believe the module editor should be an option
or you can just have your clients rotate their monitors :smirk:
LOL
really, none of this matters to me in the long run
if I could get all modals in HubSpot to get the first input to have focus so I can start typing without having to arrow over
and have every button in a modal that pops up be able to hit enter to submit, I’d be the happiest dev ever
i’ll sacrafice the clients UX for my own, then i’ll have time to build them a ui
like in phpmyadmin … where you can edit like in Excel or by opening the content of an entire row … like nicks screenshot
<@U2PDTMH53> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U2PDTMH53/F8CU1CW5V/screen_shot_2017-12-08_at_15.34.17.jpg|edit in-line>
<@U2PDTMH53> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U2PDTMH53/F8CU1KT4P/screen_shot_2017-12-08_at_15.34.32.jpg|edit entire row - but nicer looking then this :)>
basically what <@U25PYL3Q8> is saying but from hubdb
yup, that is an example
